wikipedia_page.main: Ronald Senator (17 April 1926 – 29 April 2015) was a British composer who divided his time between New York City and London.

History of psychosurgery in the United Kingdom
response: *Ronald Senator, Pulitzer Prize nominated British composer, underwent a leucotomy in St Andrew's Hospital, Northampton, in 1950. He described the experience in his book Requiem Letters (Marion Boyers Publishers, 1996).
